intro: Cyperus diandrus var. castaneus, commonly known as the red sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, reddish-brown flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soil conditions. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread and form dense stands. Cyperus diandrus var. castaneus is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various water conditions.
